subject: Data
title: Truthful Data, Deceptive Framing
description: A quick, practical guide to Truthful Data, Deceptive Framing.

hook.text: '9 out of 10 dentists recommend our toothpaste.' True â€” if you ask 10 dentists employed by the company.

buildup.text: The most dangerous data deceptions use real numbers presented in misleading contexts.

discovery.text: Framing effects mean the same fact feels different depending on emphasis: '90% survival' vs. '10% death rate.'

twist.text: No law requires full context. Advertisers legally use true but misleading statistics every day.

climax.text: The hardest deception to spot is the one that's technically correct but deliberately incomplete.

punchline.text: True data, false impression. The cleverest lie of all.

quiz.question: What makes 'truthful but deceptive' framing so dangerous?
options: The data is technically correct, making it hard to challenge
It only works on uneducated people
